summary: Email correspondence between law enforcement officials regarding the rescheduling of an interview with an individual named Mullen and the review of a draft affidavit for an amended search warrant for drives seized from Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence. It involves coordination between the NYPD, FBI, and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Mullen
persons.context: An individual whose interview with law enforcement is being rescheduled. The context suggests he is a person of interest or witness in the investigation.

persons.name: Paul
persons.context: Addressed in an email regarding the review of a draft affidavit for an amended search warrant related to drives from Epstein's residence.

events.title: Interview with Mullen canceled
events.description: A law enforcement official cancels an interview scheduled for this date with an individual named Mullen to focus on a search warrant application.

events.title: Draft affidavit for amended search warrant submitted
events.description: A draft affidavit in support of an amended search warrant for three drives seized from Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence is circulated for review among law enforcement and prosecutors.

keyFacts: Law enforcement was actively working on an amended search warrant application for digital drives seized from Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence as of October 2020.
An interview with an individual named Mullen was considered important enough to be rescheduled to allow focus on the warrant application.

The correspondence shows ongoing investigation and evidence review by a joint NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
The document references at least four exhibits attached to the draft search warrant affidavit.
